definition: palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.english: He said he is less thrilled that Mr. Killinger remains in command.
sentences.chinese: 他表示，對基林格繼續執掌大權的並不感到激動。

sentences.english: The future belongs to the dandy. It is the exquisites who are going to rule.
sentences.chinese: 未來屬於花花公子，而正是這些紈褲子弟將執掌權柄。

sentences.english: Then he named a new executive on the spot to run the team.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，他當場任命了一位新的管理者執掌這個團隊。

sentences.english: Tan said since Li took over the magazine's management, its circulation had seen a sharp drop.
sentences.chinese: 譚楷說，自從李昶執掌了雜誌之後，發行量急轉直下。

sentences.english: You go in his hands, a wave.
sentences.chinese: 你放開執掌他的那雙手，一個浪頭。

sentences.english: Staying in power, at least for the mean time, is President Karzai.
sentences.chinese: 卡爾扎伊總統至少在這段過渡時刻依然執掌政權。

sentences.english: But if they do, the company he runs will be the primary cause of it.
sentences.chinese: 如果真的發生了，他所執掌的公司應該是主要原因。

sentences.english: Lippi was brought from Napoli to Turin to aid in the turn around.
sentences.chinese: 裏皮應邀從那波利來到都靈執掌教鞭。

sentences.english: Gone through life and death, suffering, Ma Cuifen finally helm Tang.
sentences.chinese: 歷盡生死磨難，馬翠芬終於執掌唐家。

sentences.english: So I trust Berkshire Hathaway while 78-year-old Mr Buffett remains at the helm.
sentences.chinese: 因此，只要現年78歲的巴菲特仍然執掌，我信任。

sentences.english: In the long term, no doubt, Mr Fini still aspires to the PdL leadership.
sentences.chinese: 從長遠看來，菲尼先生無疑仍希望執掌自由人民新黨。

sentences.english: Mr Noda is the first Matsushita alumnus to lead Japan.
sentences.chinese: 野田佳彥是松下政經塾第一位執掌日本的校友。

sentences.english: Callaghan knows all about gifted tacticians wrestling control of the club having been at Anfield during Shankly's reign.
sentences.chinese: 卡拉漢知道所有香客利執掌俱樂部手腕與技巧。

definition: adoption (e.g. of a nephew as a son)/to inherit
to take turns/to work by roster
lit. to thread a needle (idiom); fig. to act as a go-between
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
the cassock and alms bowl of a Buddhist master passed on to the favorite disciple (Buddhism)/legacy/mantle
Lien Chan (1936-), Taiwanese politician, former vice-president and chairman of Guomintang
the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
